Opened issue "Support GetAllListedVersions API" (#13570) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The metadata API would not more info than versions, considering for performance, is it possible to support a parameter like `excludeUnlistedPackages` for the `GetAllVersions` API?

_Originally posted by @WeihanLi in https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/12370#issuecomment-2184274421_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The documentation for NU1105 is not up-to-date" (#13569) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Documentation for NU1105 should be expanded to include the case of the referenced project not being the part of the current solution. This is the error I am getting for this scenario:

`error NU1105: Unable to find project information for 'xxx.csproj'. If you are using Visual Studio, this may be because the project is unloaded or not part of the current solution so run a restore from the command-line. Otherwise, the project file may be invalid or missing targets required for restore.
`


---
#### Document Details

⚠ *Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com ➟ GitHub issue linking.*

* ID: e7a0653a-ec3b-3b60-ae77-a51fedf1966e
* Version Independent ID: 90a503d7-6d0f-7b9e-4c2c-45f9a9705ac7
* Content: [NuGet Error NU1105](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/errors-and-warnings/nu1105)
* Content Source: [docs/reference/errors-and-warnings/NU1105.md](https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/blob/main/docs/reference/errors-and-warnings/NU1105.md)
* Product: **nuget**
* GitHub Login: @zhili1208
* Microsoft Alias: **lzhi**

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Document NUGET_SCRATCH environment variable" (#13567) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,
The variable has been introduced in this pull request - https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4511
The associated issue should describe the rationale.
Thank you.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Reference not working after migrating to PackageReference" (#13427) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

.NET SDK Version 8.0.204

### Worked before?

Unknown

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

Hello, 
yesterday I restructured my files and projects a bit and since I did this I have this new errormessage " Must use PackageReference".

![image](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/139776864/dba9adc6-1c98-4250-bfbf-521c0c6b19f7)

I quickly found out that I have to migrate the packages.config to PackageReferences to solve this problem. 

![image](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/139776864/8cd20f39-b214-4543-950d-ec5c0c4d3b8c)

So I did the migration as shown (once with every transitive dependencies checked and once with only the Top-level dependencies).

This worked completely fine for all the projects, instead of "Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel". After the migration the reference is bugged and the "new" behavior is hard to explain. In general the reference exists:

![image](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/139776864/559c231d-0b98-4853-9de4-0089961d27b1)

and I can use it in the using section without any problems:

![image](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/139776864/e460708a-360f-4820-b69c-8c3a951d6279)

But, without doing anything I have tons of errors because of whatever reason...

![image](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/139776864/4fcc65cd-a5b5-44be-be85-743e84c8f604)

There are several datatypes that can be resolved but the properties for "Rows" and "Cells" are not being found.

![image](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/139776864/006ede65-d197-460f-8f52-950207d6957f)

I am very curious about this, did I miss something, did the migration miss something? Or might this be a problem with that package?

I am thankful for every helpful response because I cannot carry on right now...

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add docs for `NuGetAuditSuppress`" (#13493) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We're adding a new item called `NuGetAuditSuppress` that allows users to suppress individual advisories during restore and `dotnet list package --vulnerable`. We'll need to add documentation for this.

Part of https://github.com/NuGet/Client.Engineering/issues/2425

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Epic] 'dotnet nuget why' bugs and improvements" (#13566) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Audit result caching service should react to solution changes" (#13272) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "The NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as April 8th, 2024" (#72) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as April 8th, 2024. If you validate that packages are repository signed by NuGet.org using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages), the [`NuGet.exe verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, or the [`dotnet nuget verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-nuget-verify) command, you will need to take steps by April 8th, 2024 to avoid disruptions when installing packages from NuGet.org that are signed with the new certificate. 

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blogpost on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/the-nuget-org-repository-signing-certificate-will-be-updated-as-soon-as-april-8th-2024/
